1121111211.content:
Sakura found a pair of Naruto's orange pants and a black t-shirt which she quickly threw on before she exited through the window.

As she ran through the village, Sakura couldn't help but notice the glares she got from the villagers.
'Is this how they always look at Naruto?' she wondered to herself, not liking that particular thought much at all... in fact, she found herself hating how Naruto was treated.

She might have acted cold towards Naruto, but that was only because she was too weak to stray from the norm set by the popular kids at the academy. All of them had in one way or another teased the blonde boy, and she grew up thinking it was ok.

How could that be ok?

Ashamed of her actions, Sakura did some soul searching and shocked herself when she realised just how much of an asshole the brooding Uchiha actually was. He liked... no one! He never said anything nice to anyone, no matter what they did for him.

Sasuke may have lived a hard life after his brother slaughtered his clan before his eyes and forced him to relive it through the might of the Mangekyo Sharingan, but he had never been truely alone. If he needed anything, the villagers would all run over eachother to be the one to help him. The villagers would die for him. The village council would bend over and take a bat up their ass if it would please Sasuke... he had so much to be thankful for, yet he chose to be an ass and live a life of hatred.

Could she love a boy like that?

Could she see herself LIVING with a guy like that?

He might be cute, but he's not that special. If not for his name, he would just be another prettyboy in the pack of good looking shinobi. Nothing special.

No, Sakura didn't take long to decide Sasuke wasn't worth her effort anymore. After all, if you think about it, she had someone who loved her enough to take deadly attacks to save her. Someone who showed his worth in a fight with an A-rank missing nin who caught their sensei and rendered the Uchiha useless with killing intent alone. Strong, kind, loving, generous... she had blown off the chance to be with someone who would treat her like a queen, and for what? The prince of emo?

Sakura turned on her heel and ran into a clothing store. She was going to do something for Naruto, and somehow make it up to him. She needed him in her life, and this ties the two together more than anything before.

Two minutes later, she finds herself on her ass outside the shop after the owner himself threw her out claiming they didn't sell their goods to "demons".

Blinking away tears, Sakura did a quick henge into Uchiha Sasuke and went back in. This time the owner couldn't be sweeter, and she walked back out with a whole new outfit completely free of charge. The owner was just happy the last Uchiha honored him with a visit to his humble shop...

Sakura thought back to the time she spent in the dressing room trying on various articles of clothing. A bright blush covered her whiskered cheeks as she remembered just how good looking Naruto actually was.

'How the hell could I have missed out on this hot piece of ass for so long? No matter, I'll make him mine... SHANNARO'

Lost in thought, the smartly dressed blonde ran towards where she felt her own chakra signature. She had traded the orange pants for black pants with black bandages tied tightly from her ancles and half way up to her knee. Her standard shinobi sandals were traded in for thin black boots in dragon's hide. Sturdy and tough, yet insanely comfortable, and not to forget flame resistant. On her upper body she wore a blood red singlet with nine black stripes on her back, and a black jacket covering it. Her forehead protector was now fit around her waist, leaving the yellow strands of hair framing the boyishly handsome face perfectly, bringing out the blue in her eyes.

She did notice girls taking second looks at the hot guy running past them, and couldn't help but smirk as she remembered that the guy they all lusted for was hers and hers alone!

Naruto woke up and stretched, before putting her feet on the ground, ready to start the day.

But before she could get up, she let out an 'eep' of surprise as a masculine hand grabbed her chest and pulled her back into bed.

Naruto let out a sigh and rolled her green eyes as she gazed fondly at her boyfriend, Sakura.

Sakura mumbled, "Too early..."

Then, the blond pulled his former body closer to him.

Naruto chuckled, "Even after all these years, you're still as cute as the day we met."

Sakura opened one blue eye and pouted, "I'm not cute. I'm a guy."

Naruto kissed him, "Yes, and you're my guy. But we have to get up, we don't want people to know that we slept in the same bed the night before our wedding, do you?"

11211112111221.content:
Sakura groaned as he sat up, "Who cares? Let them know that I slept with the hottest girl in the village the night before I married her. Not like we had sex or anything."

Naruto rolled her eyes, "Sakura, I told you. I was very tired from my shift in the hospital last night, and I was in no mood to-"

Sakura cut her off with a kiss.

The pink-haired girl melted into it.

Three years ago, these two swapped bodies. After a short time of creating chaos for everyone who knew them and paid attention to their actions, they learned how to masquerade as each other. Of course, at first they wanted to swap back. But they decided to stay in each other's bodies for a week before looking for an answer. A week turned into a month.

Eventually, it became until someone realized it.

And then, they decided to stay like this even if someone did figure it out.

And against all odds, no one figured it out, and Sakura, as Naruto, became the 'hero of the leaf,' while Naruto, as Sakura, became a famous medic-nin.

And now, the two have fallen in love, and Naruto is about to fulfill his childhood fantasy about marrying Sakura. Although, the part about becoming Sakura was not a part of his dream.

Naruto pushed Sakura away, "Really, you know how a lot of villagers are about tradition. If they hear about this, then their could be a scandal."

Sakura grinned, "So? I want people to know that we sleep together."

Looking outside, Sakura continued, "Besides, it's still dark out. We have enough time to enjoy ourselves before we have to get ready."

Before Naruto could reply, Sakura started sucking her earlobes, making Naruto gasp in pleasure.

113.content:
Hinata was watching Naruto like always, wishing that they knew each other well enough to be able to speak to him and let him know she cared for him.

Needless to say, a certain ghost knew about Hinata's all-too-easy-to-figure out feelings

"I'll do it, but I don't think I should..." he mumbled, but she was the one person in Leaf that actually cared for Naruto as a person, so he pushed his troubles about this idea aside.

Hinata was suddenly in a white room with someone who liked like an adult Naruto in front of her. Hinata's eyes bulged; she knew EXACTLY who this person was.

"L-l-l-lord 4-4-4-4th H-h-h-Hokage!?" Hinata stampeded, what was going on?!

"Hello Hinata, I see you still enjoy watching Naruto." the 4th said, Hinata gulped and turned red at this, not red, but RED-RED.

"I-i-i-is i-i-i-i-it t-t-t-t-that o-o-o-o-o-obvious?" the timid Hyuga asked, even the late 4th Hokage knew about her feelings for Naruto? That was way too much.

The 4th laughed merrily "I'm afraid so, I want you to know Naruto played the most important role in my saving the village, so I'll help you get to understand Naruto's life better."

Hinata felt ready to faint, was this a dream? Was the 4th actually going to help her understand Naruto well enough so she could tell him her feelings?

"B-b-b-but lord 4th hoka..."

The 4th stopped her with a wave of his hand "Please, there's no need for formalities, my name is Yondaime."

Hinata was stunned. The forth wanted her to address him by his name?!?

"Err...T-t-t-t-thank y-y-y-y-you, but why would you do this for me?" Hinata asked.

Yondaime sighed and shook his head, a look of sadness clouding over his eyes. "Because you're the only one in Leaf that actually cared for Naruto as a person." he said

Hinata gasped in horror and shock at that answer.

"I have a new Jutsu that can help you learn about Naruto as if you were in his body." Yondaime informed her

Hinata felt ready to drop dead from shock, if she liked seeing Naruto, then the chance of being in his BODY was...Hinata felt dizzy.

"...But, keep this in mind Hinata, if I do this and you see a gate inside of Naruto, DO NOT GO NEAR IT! Understand? No matter how badly you want to find out everything there is about Naruto, stay AWAY from that gate!" Yondaime said, suddenly serious, deathly serious.

Hinata nodded, frightened by the fourth's sudden change in personality.

Sakura unfurled the scroll between herself and her sensei and quickly performed the necessary hand signs. "Body Swap Jutsu." She said with authority.

Kakashi blinked and the next thing he knew he was looking at himself. He looked down and examined his body. Slender, young and no major battle scars. Everything about this transformation was so surreal. Kakashi had performed transformation and disguise jutsu before, but those were just illusions, this was the real thing.

"Wow, it's so cool being you, Kakashi sensei." Sakura said from Kakashi's body. "The confidence. The power! It's exhilirating." She said before getting an idea.
